class vizasm.analysis.asm.cpu.memory.Memory.Memory(cpu)[source]¶

Bases: object, vizasm.analysis.asm.cpu.Resetable.Resetable

Manages the memory of the Cpu. This includes Register`s as well as the `StackFrame.

Parameters:

cpu: Cpu :

the corresponding cpu

_registers: Registers :

Registers of the cpu

_stack: StackFrame :

Stack of the cpu

Methods

get_argument([register, objc_msgSend_stret]) Get an argument from the specified Register.
get_arguments(cnt, register_list[, try_only]) Look up the values of Register`s and return a list of the looked up values, but only if the `Cpu fetches arguments from stack (returns []).
get_arguments_from_asm_heuristic() Use the number of arguments (stack and register usage since last call, See the AssignmentMatchingSystem) to determine the number of arguments for the function.
get_arguments_from_registers(cnt, register_list) Look up the values of registers and return a list of the looked up values, but only if the Cpu fetches arguments from stack (returns []).
get_arguments_from_stack(cnt[, try_only]) Get a number of stack arguments.
get_cpu()
get_registers()
get_stack()
reset() Reset the memory by resetting the registers and stack
set_cpu(value)
set_return_register_value(value) Set the value for the return register
cpu¶

cpu(Cpu) – the corresponding cpu

get_argument(register=None, objc_msgSend_stret=False)[source]¶

Get an argument from the specified Register. If the Cpu fetches its arguments from stack, pop it from where.

Parameters:

register: Register :

from which Register to get_from_idx the argument
get_arguments(cnt, register_list, try_only=False)[source]¶

Look up the values of Register`s and return a list of the looked up values, but only if the `Cpu fetches arguments from stack (returns []).

Parameters:

cnt: int :

the number of arguments to look up

register_list:list<Register> :

the register list from which to get the value

try_only: bool, optional (default is False) :

If True no exception will be raised if not all values could be looked up. Tries to get the maximum number of arguments it can until one is None
Returns:

arguments: list<object> :

list of resolved registers
Raises:

MemoryCouldNotGetAllRegisterValues :

raised if not all values could be looked up and not try_only

MemoryCouldNotGetAllStackValues :

raised if not all values could be looked up and not try_only
get_arguments_from_asm_heuristic()[source]¶

Use the number of arguments (stack and register usage since last call, See the AssignmentMatchingSystem) to determine the number of arguments for the function.

Only works if the c function call arguments heuristic is enabled!

Returns:list<object> :

Bases: vizasm.analysis.asm.cpu.memory.MemoryLookupException.MemoryLookupException

otherwise

resolve_current_register_value(register)[source]¶

Resolve the current register value. If the register has an entry in the registers dictionary this will be returned. Otherwise the register will be returned

class vizasm.analysis.asm.cpu.memory.StackFrame.StackFrame(cpu)[source]¶

Bases: object, vizasm.analysis.asm.cpu.Resetable.Resetable

Represents a stack frame.

Let r10 = arg1, r11 = arg2, rbx = arg3, then pushes to stack look like (x86_64 example):

“0000000100002b67 4C891424 mov qword [ss:rsp], r10

0000000100002b6b 4C895C2408 mov qword [ss:rsp+0x8], r11

0000000100002b70 48895C2410 mov qword [ss:rsp+0x10], rbx”

The example leads to the stack: arg1, arg2, arg3 (with top of the stack = left, lowest address)

Parameters:

__stack: dict<int, object> :

stack of the CPU

__cpu: Cpu :

Methods

add(value, address) Add an object to the StackFrame.
add_from_idx(value, idx) Add an value from given idx
get_cpu()
get_from_idx(idx) Get element from given idx.
get_stack()
pop() Pop item.
reset()
set_cpu(value)
set_stack(value)
stack_is_empty() Return whether the stack is empty
add(value, address)[source]¶

Add an object to the StackFrame. The stack grows to higher addresses, meaning that the top of the stack is always the value with the lowest address. The order in which the elements are added does not play any role. The order is given by the address.

Parameters:address: int :
add_from_idx(value, idx)[source]¶

Add an value from given idx

cpu¶
get_cpu()[source]¶
get_from_idx(idx)[source]¶

Get element from given idx.

Raises:

NoSuchStackObjectAtIdxException :

if there is no object at the given idx
get_stack()[source]¶
pop()[source]¶

Pop item. Top of stack is the lowest address

reset()[source]¶
set_cpu(value)[source]¶
set_stack(value)[source]¶
stack¶

__stack(dict<int, object>) – stack of the CPU
